metadata.title: CVE-2024-36891 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:maple_tree: fix mas_empty_area_rev() null pointer dereference Currently thecode calls mas_start() followed by mas_data_end() if the maple state isMA_START, but mas_start() may return with the maple state node == NULL.This will lead to a null pointer dereference when checking information inthe NULL node, which is done in mas_data_end(). Avoid setting the offset ifthere is no node by waiting until after the maple state is checked for anempty or single entry state. A user could trigger the events to cause akernel oops by unmapping all vmas to produce an empty maple tree, thenmapping a vma that would cause the scenario described above.

criterions.comment: linux package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-aws package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gke package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble is affected and needs fixing.

linux-oracle package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-intel package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
